website_summaries.verdict: Nothing fancy and no extra bells and whistles – but if you are looking for the classic Mr. Potato Head that kids have loved for generations, this is it.
pros: Potato head with features that include a hat, mustache, shoes, and more – 13 pieces total
cons: Some consumers gripe about ill-fitting pieces, a common issue with the toy

customer_reviews.title: Cutting corners, Hasbro?
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not the Mr Potato Head you had when you were a kid. The hatch on his butt to keep the pieces in his belly just pops off instead of hinging like it should, and the pieces feel hard and brittle. He’s ok for a less expensive alternative to the “official” Toy Story version and my little guy doesn’t know the difference, but Mama does and it’s pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: AlaskaKayakMama

customer_reviews.title: Not like when i was growing up, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: They sure don't make classic toys like they used to. I bought this for my 3 yr old daughter and it's pretty cheap feeling. The eyes are almost impossible for me to get in and out, she can't do them at all. The arms hardly stay in they are so loose. The hat falls out. Just not like they were when i was growing up 20 some years ago . Would not buy again. Maybe I got a defective potato head....?
customer_reviews.author: A R

customer_reviews.title: Get an older version at flea market
customer_reviews.text: These new potatoe heads use different plastic and the pieces don’t go in and out easily. Even after having this toy for my kids for a about a year. They get frustrated with it. I even have trouble getting the pieces in and out of the holes on the potatoe head. Look for 1980’s or 1990’s version.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Timmy

customer_reviews.title: What you see pictured is what comes with it ... pieces are hard to put in.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with as many accessories as I remember ... but his shoes have now become pants and shoes which is cool. When the pants are on the storage door won't open. The arm pieces are very hard for my 4 year old son to get in the holes almost like they are too big and they are bent kinda odd. I didn't pay much for this so it wasn't too bad but my son was disappointed that it didn't come with anything other than what is pictured. My oldest use to have one and it came with a few hats and a few mouth pieces a couple noses .. with this set what you see is what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Eden C

customer_reviews.title: Meh..
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it’s a classic and a staple but the feet are not the best. They cause him to lean. It’s the basic 2 ears, 1 hat, 1 set of eyes, 2 arms, 1 nose, 1 mustache, 1 mouth Kiddo is 2 and really didn’t take to it. Not sure if it’s because of the lack of options.
customer_reviews.author: Pineiro Family

customer_reviews.title: Quality has changed
customer_reviews.text: This was so much better when I was a kid, 20 years ago. Now that I bought this for my kid, I see why it is only 8 bucks. The plastic is super hard and cheap. Nothing is bendy, not even the arms, just hard plastic that is easily breakable. It keeps my two year slightly entertained but the pieces are tough to go in and out of the holes so she gets frustrated and loses interest. I don't blame her
customer_reviews.author: Raven the MavenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy, modern (cheap crap) quality
customer_reviews.text: This is still a great ~~idea~~ for a toy after all these years, but quality has certainly gone down. The parts and pieces don't fit together very easily, even for me. For example, the peg that is supposed to slide into the hole will bend either because the hole is too small or because the peg is too cheap. I have to leave it as-is with a gap or else I'm afraid I'll break it. It will do the job, but definitely cheap quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chilehead Craig

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and the pieces fit in well with reasonable resistance without falling out
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this Mr. Potato Head toy. I was nervous purchasing this because I have read so many bad reviews about the new Mr. Potato dolls not working right or not being made as well as the 1980’s and 90’s versions. I took the risk and purchased this new one and I am glad I did. This was extremely inexpensive and Mr. Potato Head feels sturdy and his pieces work great and go in the holes with reasonable resistance as to help small children master their fine motor skills. I gave this as a birthday gift to my 2 year old and she loves and so does her 4 year old big sister.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Q

customer_reviews.title: Kept it but some pieces are loose and others too hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: I kept it because I needed it for my toddler’s speech therapy sessions. But the accessories are either too lose or too hard to place specially for a 2 years old. Even for me actually. The ears, the mouth and the eyes are a loose fit. One hit or move and they fall off. The arms and the nose are super hard to make it go in all the way. I have to help my toddler every time with these because he just can’t push them that easily. Also the box came in horrible shape so if you are planning to gift this be ware that maybe you might have to order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Rise G.

customer_reviews.title: Cool for the nostalgia.
customer_reviews.text: I mean, they just don't make them like they use to. Much cheaper feeling. Pieces don't quite fit right. Most pieces fit very loosely and fall right out. Definitely feels like this potato is smaller than before. Perhaps my hands were smaller when I was younger. Worthy for children to play, lose, and toss. I soley got it for nostalgia and my childhood dream of having one in my office (was it from 3rd rock from the sun??) . Mission accomplished now. Worthy or $5 and not a penny more.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great value toy, holds up well to toddler use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2.5 year old son after he used it in his occupational therapy to learn the names of facial features etc. he’s really taken with it. Of course it’s the same toy and quality you’d expect of mister potato head, no surprises there. My toddler plays fairly roughly and even months later it’s still in good condition. Like all mister potato heads it comes with a little storage door so you can store pieces inside of it when not in use which is always nice.
customer_reviews.author: Grandits FamilyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever for toddler! Great price
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best purchase ever for my toddler. He is very mechanical and this was perfect little toy to keep him busy putting the little pieces all over Mr. potato head. It is fine because they can move the pieces around and change the face which is fun for them to learn. And I couldn’t believe what a good deal this was too! Do you wish it came with a few more pieces but I feel like this was a great deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Stenson

customer_reviews.title: Cute But Not What it Used to Be
customer_reviews.text: This toy looks cute, but it's definitely not made like the version of even a few years ago. The pieces don't stay connected very well - they have a tendency to fall off when you move Mr. Potato Head pretty much anywhere. The back storage flap is flimsy and doesn't stay closed securely. Basically, this toy looks adorable, but what good is that if you can't pick it up without it falling apart?
customer_reviews.author: SEBTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Amazing addition to the family.
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this for my 2yr old. He absolutely loved it, however I couldn’t be happier for myself. Mr.Potatohead has freed up so much time, he’s done my taxes and often goes to get the produce every week, he’s really good at that given his familiarity with produce. He often sits with my wife during her emotional times and seems to really enjoy Lifetime movies. He’s assisted me with some minor car repairs, great at holding the flashlight or passing tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junky
customer_reviews.text: His bits and pieces do not stay in well at all. It’s like carrying around a puzzle and hoping it stays together. His butt pops off and my son goes crazy. So I have to stop and “fix it” 27 times a day. Not impressed playskool...
customer_reviews.author: TheMrs.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy! Must have!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS! I got one for my son and one as a gift to win at his bday party! Totally perfect and a hit. It’s such a great toy to have for the kiddos and allows them to learn the parts of their face and where everything is. It’s fun and love the hidden storage flap that hold the extra parts. I left the eye glasses and tongue inside the hidden flap until my son is a little bigger. For now he loves taking off the hat and eyes and ears and hands. Great gift! Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Reina

customer_reviews.title: Classic Mr. Potato Head!
customer_reviews.text: This is the same Mr. Potato Head I played with as a child many moons ago. I have now purchased it for my Grandson. He played with it at a friends house & loved it. Brings back memories as many of the classic toys do. My only issue is the bottom of the package keeps popping open. When we wrap it, we’ll have to take care that it stays closed until he rips it open! I recommend this toy for any toddler whose mom or gran also played with it as child!
customer_reviews.author: RestlessHeartTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to play with lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: How many Mr. Potato Head have I owned over the years?? We love Mr. Potato Head! The interchangeable parts make play more interesting. The ‘butt’ compartment holds all the extra pieces not in use. My son is able to change out the pieces easily-I think he may be leaning towards Picasso-esque artistic ability. Will continue to purchase Mr. Potato Head and friends as long as we keep adding children to our family.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Wilbourn

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a toddler and his grandpa
customer_reviews.text: My grandson has played with this toy at other friends' houses and was excited to have his own. He plays with it often. The only drawback is how the pieces fit; the holes for the arms are a bit small and require strength and dexterity to attach the arms. Of course, this give grandpa the opening he needs to help and then they can enjoy each other's company.
customer_reviews.author: Rubybenubi

customer_reviews.title: Quality is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: This is def not the usual quality of me potato heads we had for my kids or ones I had as a kid. The pin in the shoes / pants broke after 1 day of playing by a 2 years old. We had mrs potato head for example for 3 years with 3 kids - and 0 issues - so they are not new to this game or anything like that. Great early Christmas / Chanukah gift (not!)
customer_reviews.author: Liviu

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE SAME
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you're probably thinking, "Oh a Potato Head is just a Potato Head," but this seems so cheap compared to the one I had as a kid. I miss the original nose and the glasses don't stay on. My son still likes it even though he doesn't have the same nose as the one in Toy Story, but I miss the quality and character of the original...
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Mae

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I love this classic toy but the nose had a smudge on it that I can’t get off. It was a gift for my daughter and at two years of age she doesn’t care much for the smudge but I use these toys in play-based speech therapy so I hope it holds up as well as the older model. My daughter enjoyed pulling off and put on the body parts. She labeled vocabulary while she played with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Vegmom

customer_reviews.title: This is a great toy. I absolutely recommend it to anyone with ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product as a gift for my grandson. I find it amusing that I had one of these to play with as a child, now I am able to purchase one for my grandson to play with as well. He absolutely loves it. This is a great toy. I absolutely recommend it to anyone with a child. My grandson plays with it for hours on end and runs to show me what he has done. This is lots of fun for both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bibby

customer_reviews.title: Fun! 20 month old loves it. Adult supervision and assistance needed for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loved this! She's 20 months and loves assembling things so this was a treat for her. My only complaint is that the pieces need to be jammed into the holes. What I do is I let my daughter attach a piece as far as she can get it and them I jam it in. Being plastic, I hope that they are easier to attach with more time and use. Going to take this on the plane to keep her busy for a while. So far she is able to play with it for 15 to 20 minutes. Not bad for times when she will need a break from watching videos on the tablet while we're in the air.
customer_reviews.author: IH

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't feel like the old Mr
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't feel like the old Mr.Potato head I grew to love. The quality seems much more cheaply made now. But my kids don't know any different and they play with it like crazy and they love it. Minus losing pieces all the time and the quality decrease from way back (which is common these days), I still recommend this product because it has lasted and the kids enjoy it and that is what it was purchased for.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew81

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift for a kid. Its a pain to bring when traveling - so many parts can get missing. Can you imagine telling your kid you lost Mr. Potato's nose? It is a great toy for a toddler though, we have been having fun learning about the parts of the face through this.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Banana

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for little ones
customer_reviews.text: Mr. Potato Head is a great learning tool for my baby and toddler. Teaching the parts of the face and body. I gave 4 starts, because the pieces are sometimes very difficult to push in. I'm sure it has to be a tight fit, so it doesn't easily fall out. Wished there was a better way so it's easier for the kids to put together. We also received the start wars one as a gift and I think it's far cuter than this one.
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy that's great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I didn't think of buying this before now. My 2.5 year old twins are speech delayed and were having trouble with naming body parts. Their SLP suggested Mr. Potato head and it was a huge hit. They love playing with him and have started naming some body parts now.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L

customer_reviews.title: Rediscovering a classic toy...
customer_reviews.text: I never had a Mr. Potato Head as a child, so when Amazon had it as a deal before Christmas, I pounched at the opportunity to buy one for my 18-month-old twins. Surprisingly, I think I have played with it and enjoyed it more than the littlest ones. I love how all the parts fit inside the guy. Still a great, simple toy not requiring batteries :)
customer_reviews.author: GreyBandit

customer_reviews.title: Poorly manufactured and parts fall off too easy.
customer_reviews.text: Does not stay together; parts fall out and make Mr potato head useless. Also, the back plate that allows for a small amount of storage for the glasses and such also falls off way too easily. As a result, this is no fun and a waste of money. My memory is betrayed by cheap manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My toddler LOVES it! Favorite toy now!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! I knew my son would love this, but I didn’t realize it would become his absolute favorite toy!!! He’s 2 and loves it! I’m thinking maybe I should’ve gotten the one with more parts... but he seems perfectly happy with what he has!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Not the Potato you grew up with
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be fooled... this is not the real Mr Potato head, he is an imposter. He’s harder, cheaper and has way fewer pieces aka not as fun. Thankfully my child doesn’t know the difference for now but I do. What happened to the lips and teeth options? The hair, hats, shoes... this is not ok. Tragic loss to a classic.
customer_reviews.author: Avan01

customer_reviews.title: Mr Potatoe Head surprize gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought Mr Potato for my grand nephew - as a surprise funny gift. When he was about 1 year old (25 years ago) I introduced him to potatoes and all these years later he still loves them. He loves to cook them in any fashion for all our family get togethers.....but always he asks me if | like what he made...He is about to have his first child so I bought Mr and Mrs Potato Heads as a gift for a funny shower gift - we all laughed and got tears in our eyes ...another memory we will always keep in our hearts.
customer_reviews.author: Toni G Law

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old'd favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My son asked for this after he saw one at a local business. I bought it for him and he asked for it everyday until it arrived. Since it has arrived, he has played with it everyday! It's his favorite toy. He recently asked for Mrs. Potato Head to add to his collection. (He is 3 years old)
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Purvis Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Mr Potato Head
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is obsessed with Mr Potato Head. She's 16 months and it keeps her entertained for 30+ minutes at a time. It's a toy that I used to remember playing with, so I'm glad it's still around and my daughter is getting enjoyment out of it too!
customer_reviews.author: Rachhh

customer_reviews.title: Fun educational Toy
customer_reviews.text: A old time favorite of the kids. I remember this toy from when I was a kid. I purchased for my preschool class. It was a hit and a wonderful way to reinforce naming body parts in a fun hands-on way for 2, 3 and 4 year olds. I recommend for Parents and educators. And Hasbro is a trusted brand. I am a satisfied customer :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Potato's still got it!
customer_reviews.text: Mr. Potato's still got it! I was surprised my 1.5 year old likes to play with him so much, as does my 3.5 year old... she loves storing parts inside. Several of the parts (particularly arms and ears) are pretty tough to pull out and put back on though. So I have to help them every time as it can be impossible or frustrating for them to do. I wish they offered more accessory packages with different eyes, ears, etc. Great opportunity!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy for 3 year olds.
customer_reviews.text: This toy has suddenly become my 3 year olds obsession. This classic is great for developing motor skills and gets little ones creativity going. I love seeing him light up with joy as he creates a new face for Mr. Potato Head.
customer_reviews.author: Kait

customer_reviews.title: Cute idea, as always, but has some issues
customer_reviews.text: This isn't far off from what I remembered from my childhood. My daughter really likes putting all of the parts in the wrong place. My only complaint is that the door on the back where you put spare parts doesn't stay put and is not easy for her to put on. Also, the hole for the mouth/tongue is really difficult to place the pieces into. I end up doing that part for her!
customer_reviews.author: Tame the Ghosts

customer_reviews.title: The pieces don't stay in very good & easily fall out
customer_reviews.text: The toy is a classic but it's not up to the same standard as the one I use to have. The pieces don't stay in very good & easily fall out. The back hatch to store extra pieces is not easily opened by myself much less my child. He still likes it though.
customer_reviews.author: c96cmr

customer_reviews.title: Original favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: Original favorite toy From my childhood they still make it I brought one for my grandson and he loves it I am going to get Mrs. potato head next every child who is a fan of toy story will love this toy I recommend and the price was great
customer_reviews.author: Sweetrachel

customer_reviews.title: Mr potato head
customer_reviews.text: For what I got Him for he does the job! My issue with him is the pieces are very stiff and the back flap part isn’t made well that it keeps popping out... for the price I can see pass these issues but I feel that a brand that’s been a around for so long should have these things worked out..
customer_reviews.author: M.Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My son loves him. The opening in the back holds all the pieces except the hat and pants/shoes. Which is Great for clean up. Easy to use for my 2.5yr old. And a Great price
customer_reviews.author: candice

customer_reviews.title: It's a mr. Potatoe head.
customer_reviews.text: It's a muster potatoes head. I wish it came with more choices. It stinks it only has one set of what it needs. But thatd how they make mo ey I guess. Son opened it for xmas. Everything lost 1 month later
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a 3 year old -he loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Mr Potato head the little guy has had and oh boy did he love it - family was very pleased with my gift, it's hard to believe something so inexpensive is such a great long lasting toy!
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Helps kids be creative by playing around with the face, my only gripe is the back door doesn’t want to snap properly to keep itself closed. Regardless for the value and the entertainment it provides to kids I’m sure they don’t mind a small issue.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: My son's favorite birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 5 year old sons birthday this year, thinking he might like it since he loves Toy Story. Not only does he like it but I would say it is his favorite gift. Box was easy to open, The parts all store easily into his storage space, and they are easy to change up. We have only had it a few days but seems pretty durable for my 5 and 2 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Jones

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy for kids!
customer_reviews.text: We bought Playskool Mr. Potato Head when it was at a great price and plan on giving it as a gift along with Mrs Potato Head. Both look exactly like the ones from years ago that many kids enjoyed.
customer_reviews.author: citrushome

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: A good fun learning toy. Decent quality construction for the price. Kiddo loves it. Pieces can be stiff but probably will even out after due usage. It has a nice little flap where all the accessories can fit. Would also make a lovely gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amreen

customer_reviews.title: My Granddaughter’s Face Lit Up When She Opened This Gift
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gift for my granddaughter who is 5! This was the one thing she had asked for and her little face just lit up when she saw Mr Potato Head! Amazon made my Christmas shopping so much easier and their Black Friday week sales saved me lots of money!
customer_reviews.author: Medic236

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy!
customer_reviews.text: Its a great toy! My two year old son loves it, especially a great way to teach your kids about his/hers body parts, it’s simple and a nice way for them to learn and think where each body part goes!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M.

customer_reviews.title: ALREADY USED!
customer_reviews.text: Product was repackaged very poorly (was suppose to be new?) and all the parts are dirty disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Corey Easton

customer_reviews.title: Good gift
customer_reviews.text: This is not the same mr. Potato head I remember from my childhood. While my Toy Story obsessed 3 year old loved it, I was disappointed by how cheap it felt and gave it a quick wash to eliminate some of the plastic smell. It did make a great gift, I just wish they made things like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: It's just fun.
customer_reviews.text: The only negative is that the parts are just ever-so-loose. So....especially when you put on the glasses....well...the ears fall off. But it was a gag gift anyway, so it doesn't matter that much. It was inexpensive. It was cheaply made. But the cost reflected that. So, in spite of the holes being just a little too large, it was worth the money. It brings a laugh every single day.
customer_reviews.author: Sherschwa

customer_reviews.title: Newer, not better
customer_reviews.text: Of course later copies of originals are not as good as the originals. This is the case with Mr. Potato Head. The glasses don't fit properly on the ears. The arms come off way too easily. But it is what it is, and little kids like it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Lowes

customer_reviews.title: Classic
customer_reviews.text: A classic potato head! My son isn’t super into him right now as he is only 2. He will manipulate some of the pieces but he losses interest pretty fast. I think as he gets older, he will have more fun exchanging out the different pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Just what she wantef
customer_reviews.text: It was a great Christmas present for my granddaughter. She loves Toy Story. She already had a Mrs Potato Head and wanted a Mr Potato head tp go with her She loves them both.
customer_reviews.author: hrv

customer_reviews.title: Great Classic Toy
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old son loves this! I remember loving mine when I was a kid. However, he has the pieces scattered all over the place. They really hurt when you step on them! High ouch factor. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: April Burke

customer_reviews.title: Old school toy still found fun by modern kid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter along with the Mrs. potato head. It's so cool to watch your kid play with something that you played with 20 something years ago. Anyway she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: large size
customer_reviews.text: just received him and my 3 year old grandson was so happy, but this one started falling apart before we got him out of the box. great size for a toddler
customer_reviews.author: Edna Tollison

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy ...
customer_reviews.text: An evolution of the original Mr. Potato Head. My daughter loves playing with it. The plastic feels a little cheaper than previous versions, but it doesn’t detract from play. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: TravelingReviewer

customer_reviews.title: So cute
customer_reviews.text: Mr potAtoe head has changed a lot. But it’s still cute. I feel like his “pants” with the shoes are a better design than just trying to keep the shoes on in the old kind. Classic toy for all to love
customer_reviews.author: Hoodschwinked

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy, not made how it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: My son love it, but it definitely isn’t the same as when I was a kid. The pieces are plastic as opposed to the rubbery feel of when I was younger. The pieces are loose in the holes and fall out kind of easily but my toddler doesn’t really care so I guess it’s not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 2yr old play with it everyday and unfortunately after a few days, some parts are missing lol. How do you prevent a 2yr old from hiding things? Any help is appreciated. lol
customer_reviews.author: BenSam

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP MADE
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap made! It is nothing like the older version Mr. Potato Head. It was frustrating for me to help my Pre-School children work with it. The back kept coming off, parts do not stay in holes (especially on the top). Don’t buy this newer version, it’s a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: THUNDER#1

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality , loose body organs
customer_reviews.text: It is very interesting how most are the reviews are good . Unfortunately we did not receive a good quality , actually very poor quality, pieces dont stay and fall easily . Makes my child so upset .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Potato head and they are both extremely cute and I think that they are great for teaching body parts and clothing to toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I got both Mr. & Mrs. Potato head and they are both extremely cute and I think that they are great for teaching body parts and clothing to toddlers. My two year old really enjoys playing with them. With that said, I was disappointed in the quality. I remember having these toys when I was a kid and they were built much, much better. The toy being so lightweight is great, but the pieces don't want to stay in which is a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Labadie

customer_reviews.title: Simple but fun
customer_reviews.text: Mr. Potato head is a simple toy but is still fun for toddlers. The pieces stay in and the flap on the back stays closed a lot better than the Toy Story versions.
customer_reviews.author: Rbel

customer_reviews.title: Great non-electronic classic fun!
customer_reviews.text: The classic Mr. Potato Head that is quality made with parts that fit tightly in the holes. My daughter only wished the arms moved since they are locked in the one position. Also the legs and hat can't be stored away in the backend storage hatch. Great to have this entertaining non-electronic toy in the toy box!
customer_reviews.author: Brett G

customer_reviews.title: Still a good toy
customer_reviews.text: It's not the same toy I had when I was young, but my 2 year old doesn't know that. She plays with him constantly. My only complaint would be that the glasses don't like to stay on. Plan to order Mrs. potato head for Christmas or extra pieces for her to change his look.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca G.

customer_reviews.title: Old School Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy. It's inexpensive and while she's had this toy from birth, she really started playing with Mr. PH around 10 months and has really enjoyed it ever since. Only negative with this toy is the back-flap where you put the pieces (eyes, nose, etc.) keeps breaking off. However, my child really doesn't care... Also, could be a great gift for birthdays and baby showers!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cheap cheap
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cheap product. Cant keep the back piece to stay on and hard to put the pieces in the holes. My toddler was over it after a minute
customer_reviews.author: Megan Michelle

customer_reviews.title: grandson love him
customer_reviews.text: grandson loves potato man. I did knock it down because when I was a kid he came with a few more different eyes , hats and face pieces. other than that it is a toy he likes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: looks exactly as shown , nothing and my niece loves it and it actually came a few days before the expected delivery
customer_reviews.author: Ashleyann R.

customer_reviews.title: I'm having more fun with this than I should
customer_reviews.text: I'm having more fun with this than I should. Bought as a prop for a class lesson I was teaching, I've now stationed him on my desk and enjoy his expert advice. :) Fun and entertaining. :)
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S.

customer_reviews.title: The fun is in changing their looks
customer_reviews.text: These toys don't come with extra pieces anymore. The fun is in changing their looks. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Parts do NOT stay in!
customer_reviews.text: Pathetic. I bought this for my two year old to replace her old one that the parts no longer stay in well. She loves this and calls it "Steve Harvey". When the new one came in, I opened the factory packaging and most of the parts just fell off the potato. They don't stay in and my daughter is upset about it. Honestly, normally I wouldn't care to leave a review, but I don't want any other children getting let down and or sad about this product.
customer_reviews.author: David Dyce

customer_reviews.title: Adorable
customer_reviews.text: A classic. Arrived on time and in good condition. Packaged well. Good size. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Lsapphire

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy
customer_reviews.text: I had this toy when I was a kid and recently bought it as a gift for my son. The quality isn’t quite as good as it used to be, it still seems to be good. It’s kept my son entertained and he enjoys playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: Mr potato Head is the best
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her Mr. Potato Head. I was pretty excited about getting him too. And I love how he has a butt! It's not just shoes. It's shoes with his pants on it too lol
customer_reviews.author: Jane Wood

customer_reviews.title: Fun For Younger Children
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 4-year-old grandson. He loves it and for the moment, it is his favorite toy. He just loves taking it apart and putting it back together, sometimes not in their "proper" place to pretend the Mr. Potato Head is a monster or something else. He gets a kick out of it. There is an covered opening in the back to hold extra pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Torres

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: the old ones were better in every way. this one is smaller, cheaper, not as good in every way.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Fun gift!
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for a great price! It is exactly what you get and what you paid for super fun for my toddler he loves to put his face parts in different places lol.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! This potato head is great! We bought the Mrs (Pixar versión) and the pieces were loose. This Potato Head is awesome! Pieces fit nice and snug, and they store well in the back of the toy. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful toy
customer_reviews.text: My almost two year old grandson is in love with this mr. Potato Head. I had one when I was little too. He likes to put the ears where the eyes go and then he laughs like crazy
customer_reviews.author: Pattie J

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for kids
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and a great last minute gift for smaller kids. You can store all the parts in the potatoe itself so nothing gets misplaced.
customer_reviews.author: Nasa N

customer_reviews.title: Classic Mr Potato Head. Can’t go wrong!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves Mr. Potato heads, he has all kinds of avengers ones, mrs potato head, you name it. This one is another classic. Can never have too many interchangeable pieces. Two thumbs up. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler S

customer_reviews.title: Basic toy
customer_reviews.text: Package came damaged it was hard to wrap for a Christmas gift. Basic Mr Potatohead all the parts so fit inside except the pants.
customer_reviews.author: CHale

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy
customer_reviews.text: He’s great, slightly different than the one I remember as a child but it’s fine. I love that it came already assembled and the packaging was frustration free.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah C.

customer_reviews.title: It's Mr. Potato Head!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's Mr. Potato Head, what can I say? He's a good friend of the family and always welcomed in our home!! Kids love him too!!
customer_reviews.author: Rene Welch

customer_reviews.title: For Christmas
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 yr old grandson for Christmas. Who doesnt love Mr Potato Head...He sure is going to love taking this one apart and putting it back together...
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Pieces don’t stay on
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. None of the pieces stay on the potato. The ears, one arm and the glass will not stay on no matter how I twist them. Super bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Fun Mr Potato, good size for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: the pieces are sturdy and in bright colors. Great way to learn about body parts! good price, but no real box /bag to use, so I keep it in a quarter zip-lock bag.
customer_reviews.author: child development לשבת לקום

customer_reviews.title: Classic toy. Minor hiccup with back storage flap.
customer_reviews.text: Classic Mr Potatohead toy. This always comes out when we are watching Toy Story. My only concern/dissatisfaction with this toy is that the back flap comes off. This is a problem because my toddler cannot put it back together and gets misplaced.
customer_reviews.author: JennKTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, poor design
customer_reviews.text: All as expected, except the compartment in the back is not easy to open due to the foot/lower body. The blue area gets in the way of the little door opening.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Val

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the price. Our 5 year old loves it. Pieces are interchangeable with Mrs Potato head too (bought seperately).
customer_reviews.author: Christopher_R

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality, rickety and cheap
customer_reviews.text: The quality on this Mr. potato head is a joke. It’s tiny, everything hardly fits, it’s rickety, it’s cheaply made and I definitely wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Zubkov

customer_reviews.title: That's pretty boring and
customer_reviews.text: This actually only comes with exactly what's show. No extra parts. Potato Heads used to come w/ a variety of arms and facial parts to mix and match, not just one set. That's pretty boring and... rather pointless.
customer_reviews.author: xnewyorkhardcorex

customer_reviews.title: The secret to keeping a 2 year old quiet
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old LOVES this since he’s obsessed with Toy Story. It’s also one toy that will keep him engaged for more than a few minutes. The arms are little hard to put in on the one I got but otherwise it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Always fun
customer_reviews.text: Always a classic. I played with Mr and Mrs Potatoe Head as a child. Back then we had to use real potatoes! My 4 year old great grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy J.

product_meta.title: Playskool Mr. Potato Head
product_meta.description:
Mr Potato Head Playskool

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
A slimmer, more active Mr. Potato Head has more holes than he used to and more facial features. Your child will love putting his nose where his ear should be and building many different versions of the original potato friend.Ages: 2 years and up
feature_bullets: The parts are compatible with other versions of Mr. or Mrs. Potato Head
Mr. Potato Head has had a makeover and now has legs, more accessory holes, and a slimmer look
Store the parts in the figure’s Tater Tush. Potato figure comes with eyes, nose, mouth with teeth, hat, mustache, tongue, pair of glasses, 2 hands, 2 ears and 1 pair of legs with shoes
Your child will love putting his nose where his ear should be and building many different versions of the original potato friend
The parts are compatible with other versions of Mr. or Mrs. Potato Head

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,706 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
